__inputs.name: DS_PROMETHEUS
__inputs.label: Prometheus datasource. When CEEMS LB is enabled, datasource corresponding to CEEMS LB must be configured here.

description: Time series metrics of a Openstack VM

options.content:
The following metrics are aggregated over the entire life duration of the VM

Average Utilization (%) CPU ${cpu_usage}
CPU Memory ${cpumem_usage}
GPU ${gpu_usage}
GPU Memory ${gpumem_usage}
Energy Consumption (kWh) Host ${cpu_energy}
GPU ${gpu_energy}
Total ${total_energy}
Equivalent Emissions (gms) Emission Factor RTE Electricity Maps OWID
Host ${cpu_emissions_rte} ${cpu_emissions_emaps} ${cpu_emissions_owid}
GPU ${gpu_emissions_rte} ${gpu_emissions_emaps} ${gpu_emissions_owid}
Total ${total_emissions_rte} ${total_emissions_emaps} ${total_emissions_owid}

Following table gives different VM meta data

Attribute Value
UUID ${uuid}
Name ${name}
Account ${account}
Created At ${submit:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS Z}
Started At ${start:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS Z}
Ended At ${end:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS Z}
Elapsed Time ${elapsed}
State ${state}

This dashboard presents the time series metrics of VM ${uuid} running under project ${account}. Currently the following time series metrics are available: - **CPU Stats**: - *CPU Usage*: This shows the usage of CPU by the VM and it is estimated using CPU time. In one second interval, if CPU works only for 0.2 seconds, CPU usage will be reported as 20%. If a VM has _n_ cpus and uses all _n_ cpus all the time, the usage will be 100% all the time. If the VM uses only _n/2_ cpus or uses _n_ cpus only 50% of time, the resulting CPU usage will be 50%. - *CPU Memory Usage*: This is the percentage of memory used by the VM compared to the total memory available to the VM. - *Host Energy Usage*: This is the energy consumption estimated based on total energy consumption (excluding GPUs) of the compute node and the resources used by the VM. Thus it includes CPU, CPU memory and other peripherals on the compute node excluding GPUs. The estimation is made using CPU time, memory used by the VM relative to total CPU time and total memory used by the compute node. If there are multiple VMs running on the node at a given time, the reported energy consumption is the energy consumed only by the current VM.
- **GPU Stats**: - *GPU Usage*: This shows the GPU usage reported by [NVML](https://developer.nvidia.com/management-library-nvml). According to [NVML docs](https://docs.nvidia.com/deploy/nvml-api/structnvmlUtilization__t.html#structnvmlUtilization__t), it is percent of time over the past sample period during which one or more kernels was executing on the GPU. - *GPU Memory Usage*: This is the percentage of memory used by the VM compared to the available memory on the GPU. - *GPU Energy Usage*: This is the energy consumption reported by [NVML](https://developer.nvidia.com/management-library-nvml) by the GPU.
- **GPU Profiling Stats**: NVIDIA DCGM [docs](https://docs.nvidia.com/datacenter/dcgm/latest/user-guide/feature-overview.html#profiling-metrics) explains all the presented GPU profiling metrics.
- **IO Stats**: - *Read/Write bandwidths*: Read/Write bandwidths for different file systems. - *Read/Write Requests*: Number of requests for read/write for different file systems. - *Read/Write Errors*: Number of errors while executing read/write requests for different file systems.
